conclusion: Analyze the motion of both the pedestrian and the bus using the velocity-time graphs.
The pedestrian runs at a constant speed of 8 m/s.
The bus starts from rest and accelerates uniformly, reaching 8 m/s in 8 seconds.
The acceleration of the bus is 1 m/s².
The pedestrian starts 36 meters behind the bus.
The position of the pedestrian as a function of time is x_p(t) = 8t - 36.
The position of the bus as a function of time is x_b(t) = 0.5t².
The pedestrian catches up with the bus when x_p(t) = x_b(t).
Substitute the expressions for x_p(t) and x_b(t): 8t - 36 = 0.5t².
Rearrange the equation to 0.5t² - 8t + 36 = 0 and multiply by 2: t² - 16t + 72 = 0.
Solve the quadratic equation using the quadratic formula.
A negative discriminant indicates no real solutions for t.
The pedestrian cannot catch up with the bus.
